definition: unsavory meal taken in remembrance of past hardships/fig. poor-tasting meal
to recollect/to remember/memory
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly

sentences.english: Another important activity was recalling the sorrow of the past by eating meals of that time.
sentences.chinese: 再有一项重大活动说是吃忆苦饭。

definition: to view one's past as miserable and one's present as happy (idiom)
meal cooked in a large pot/communal meal/(fig.) system that rewards everyone equally regardless of merit
lit. to eat from the common pot (idiom)/fig. to be rewarded the same, regardless of performance

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)

a kind of a bread
corn flour mixed with a little soybean flour

mixed dish of the food left over from a banquet
large kitchen stove made from bricks or earth/(PRC) ordinary mess hall (lowest dining standard, ranked below 中灶[zhong1 zao4] for mid-level cadres and 小灶[xiao3 zao4] for the most privileged)
